text: Ongar railway station is a former London Underground station in the town of Chipping Ongar, Essex. Until its closure in 1994, it was the easternmost point of the Central line, and from 1961 until its closure in 1994 it held the distinction of being the London Underground station farthest from Central London.Before 1961, the Metropolitan line's north-western terminus at Aylesbury was the most distant. After Ongar's closure, the most distant is the Metropolitan line's Chesham ==References== ==Other websites== * London Transport Museum Photographic Archive ** ** *Epping Ongar Railway's official website *London's Abandoned Tube Stations - Ongar station *London's Abandoned Tube Stations - Epping to Ongar branch Category:Disused London Underground stations Category:Transport in Epping Forest Category:Epping Ongar Railway Category:Former single platform tube stations Category:1865 establishments in the United Kingdom Category:1994 disestablishments in the United Kingdom Category:1990s disestablishments in England
title: Ongar railway station
